Legal_Issue: Whether the Tribunal's decision to order a new election was reasonable under the Gitxaala Nation Custom Election Code
Application_Facts: 13 ballot irregularities were found to affect the election outcome; the Applicant challenged procedural errors in the Tribunal's process
Decision_Outcome: The Tribunal's decision was found to be reasonable and within the range of acceptable outcomes
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Tribunal's decision to order a new election
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; costs awarded to the Intervenor
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged ballot irregularities and procedural errors in the Tribunal's investigation
Assessment_Factor: Justification, transparency, and intelligibility of the Tribunal's decision-making process
Procedural_Issue: Tribunal's investigative methods and adherence to procedures under the Election Code
Application_Basis: Disputed election results due to alleged irregularities
Relief_Sought: Overturning the Tribunal's decision to order a new election
Governing_Rule: Standard of review for mixed questions of fact and law is reasonableness
Cause_Description: Disputed election results due to alleged irregularities led to an appeal questioning the Tribunal's decision to order a new election
Evidence_Handling: Tribunal assessed ballot irregularities and determined impact on election outcome
Evidence_Assessment: Tribunal's findings on ballot irregularities were accepted as reasonable
Decision_Rationale: The Tribunal's decision was justified, transparent, and intelligible, and within its discretionary authority under the Election Code
